Date.Description: The function $$date is used to convert a date specified in string format into the 'Date' data type.This is mainly required when a string contains a date on which manipulations are to be performed treating it as a date format eg: filtering the data based on the date comparison.TDL allows Addition or substraction of a number to a date type field and in turn it will return a date type field.
Date.Name: Date

DateRange.Description: Evaluates the DateRange formula with the context of BaseDate and Inclusive formula specified.
DateRange.Name: DateRange

DayOfDate.Description: This function returns only the day from a complete date time in number format This datetime is converted to number so that some computation can be performed on this.
DayOfDate.Name: DayOfDate

DayOfWeek.Description: Gives the Day of the specified datetime, e.g., Monday. This function returns the weekday of the datetime specified. The Parameter can be any expression (i.e.,Formula / Storage/ variable etc) in datetime format.
DayOfWeek.Name: DayOfWeek

DueDateByDate.Description: This function provides the due date for a bill in date format. The parameter passed to this function is a date. It returns the due date of the bill in terms of date specified.
DueDateByDate.Name: DueDateByDate

DueDateInDays.Description: This function provides the due date for a bill in number of days format. The parameter passed to this function is a date. This returns the due date of the bill in terms of total number of days remaining with respect to the date specified in the parameter.
DueDateInDays.Name: DueDateInDays

FinYearBeg.Description: This function is used to get the First Day of the company's financial year.The function $$FinYearBeg is used to fetch the starting date of the company's financial year The 1st parameter is a Date value for which the financial year beginning is to be identified and 2nd parameter is the 'Starting From' (i.e., financial year starting from date) of company. Now there is a possibility that the financial year can begin from April, January, etc. In such cases the 2nd parameter helps the system to pick the exact financial year beginning date.
FinYearBeg.Name: FinYearBeg

FinYearEnd.Description: This function is used to get the Last day of the company's financial year.The function $$FinYearEnd is used to fetch the Ending date of the company's financial year. The 1st parameter is a Date value for which the financial year Ending is to be identified and 2nd parameter is the “Starting From” (i.e., financial year starting from date) of company. Now, there is a possibility that the financial year can be from April-March or January-December etc., . In such case the 2nd parameter helps the system to pick the exact financial year ending date. Actually it considers day & Month from the 2nd parameter and the year from the 1st parameter for calculating Financial year beginning. Hence 12 months after financial Year Beginning is financial year end.
FinYearEnd.Name: FinYearEnd

FullMonthName.Description: Gives the full name of the month eg: January etc.
FullMonthName.Name: FullMonthName

IsSetByDate.Description: This function checks if the due date is mentioned on a particular Date instead of Number of Days. It Checks the format  in which the due date is stored i.e. Whether it is in date /no. of days. If it is Date then it returns 'Yes' else 'No'.Return type is logical value.
IsSetByDate.Name: IsSetByDate

MachineTime.Description: Gives the system time. The machine time at the moment of evaluation of function – in the form HH:MM OR HH.MM.SS based on the logical parameter Return type is string.
MachineTime.Name: MachineTime

MonthEnd.Description: This function returns the Date for the last day of the given month.
MonthEnd.Name: MonthEnd

MonthOfDate.Description: This function finds the month corresponding to date.
MonthOfDate.Name: MonthOfDate

MonthStart.Description: This function returns the first day of the specified month.
MonthStart.Name: MonthStart

NextMonth.Description: This function returns the Next month date of the specified date parameter.
NextMonth.Name: NextMonth

NextYear.Description: This function returns the Next year date of the specified date parameter.The same date for the Next year – thus 10-Feb-2005 would give 10-Feb-2006.
NextYear.Name: NextYear

NumOfMonths.Description: This function returns a numeric value. It is the number of months between the given datetimes.
NumOfMonths.Name: NumOfMonths

PeriodStart.Description: Gives the Starting date of the Balancing Method for the specified object.
PeriodStart.Name: PeriodStart

PrevMonth.Description: This function returns the previous month date of the specified date parameter.
PrevMonth.Name: PrevMonth

PrevYear.Description: This function returns the date for the previous year specified as parameter.The same date is displayed for the previous year – thus 10-Feb-2005 would give 10-Feb-2004.
PrevYear.Name: PrevYear

PrintDate.Description: $$PrintDate will display the system date in the particular report whenever there is no parameters.The date of starting the print-out at the moment of evaluation of function – this will remain constant through out the printing of the current report.
PrintDate.Name: PrintDate

PrintTime.Description: To display the system time on the report.
PrintTime.Name: PrintTime

RelativeDate.Description: This function returns a date value. It gives the backdated relative date for the period specified
RelativeDate.Name: RelativeDate

ShortMonthName.Description: This function gives the name of the month in short for the specified datetime.
ShortMonthName.Name: ShortMonthName

WeekEnd.Description: This function gives the first Sunday's Date.. If the argument itself (DateTime) is a Sunday then it will return the following Sunday.
WeekEnd.Name: WeekEnd

YearEnd.Description: This Function returns the last date of the Year, by adding 11 months to the datetime parameter.
YearEnd.Name: YearEnd

YearOfDate.Description: This Function gives the four digit Year value for the date time specified.
YearOfDate.Name: YearOfDate
